p: Fewer study participants reported substance use than in prior research among transgender women in places like Brazil [ 37], Thailand [ 38], and the United States [ 39] or among MSM in southern Africa [ 40â€“ 42]. However, depression, suicidal ideation, and experiences of stigma were common. Transgender participants were more likely to report experiences of stigma and poor mental health than cis-MSM. Our findings that law enforcement stigma, violence, and depression were significantly associated with HIV are consistent with syndemic theories that structural and psychosocial factors are important synergistic drivers of HIV in gender and sexual minority populations [ 12].
